name: salvia lyrata
description: Lyre-leaved Sage flowers are white to light blue and bloom early in the season.  It is a robust, self seeding species that appreciates medium to moister soils.  Its native range is a large southeastern swath of the United States from Connecticut to Missouri, south.
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
